page.title: 20Summary
page.content: We were asked by our Geography master to consider what the Domesday Project had meant to us. When we started to discuss our findings in class, we realised that we had learnt more than we thought we would. All the people that we talked to were very friendly and helpful and we felt that we had learnt a lot about the community. Some of the older people were pleased to have someone to share their memories with. As well as our dealings with people, we also had to learn about map reading, where to find out information, how to plan the visits, what questions to ask and how to summarise all the results. { {Written by the pupils of JRN, JRS {and PR (Fourth Year 1984/85)
